relation: Date picker with spinner controls to select the date.
Date picker with calendar to select the date.
TableContextTimeStampAfterTable: {684139=Gets the maximal date supported by this DatePicker in milliseconds since January 1, 1970 00:00:00 in getDefault() time zone., 685514=Note: The default minimal date is 01/01/1900., 704924=Sets the maximal date supported by this DatePicker in milliseconds since January 1, 1970 00:00:00 in getDefault() time zone., 685229=Gets the minimal date supported by this DatePicker in milliseconds since January 1, 1970 00:00:00 in getDefault() time zone., 658202=May be a color value, in the form of "#rgb", "#argb", "#rrggbb", or "#aarrggbb"., 709595=Called by restoreHierarchyState(android.util.SparseArray) to retrieve the state for this view and its children. May be overridden to modify how restoring happens to a view's children; for example, some views may want to not store state for their children., 706065=Sets the minimal date supported by this NumberPicker in milliseconds since January 1, 1970 00:00:00 in getDefault() time zone., 657958=May be a reference to another resource, in the form "@[+][package:]type:name" or to a theme attribute in the form "?[package:][type:]name"., 684424=Note: The default maximal date is 12/31/2100.}
textBeforeTable: Must be one of the following constant values. Defines the look of the widget. Prior to the L release, the only choice was spinner. As of L, with the Material theme selected, the default layout is calendar, but this attribute can be used to force spinner to be used instead. android:datePickerMode Related Methods This corresponds to the global attribute resource symbol calendarViewShown. This may also be a reference to a resource (in the form "@[package:]type:name") or theme attribute (in the form "?[package:][type:]name") containing a value of this type. Must be a boolean value, either "true" or "false". Whether the calendar view is shown. android:calendarViewShown Related Methods This corresponds to the global attribute resource symbol calendarTextColor. This may also be a reference to a resource (in the form "@[package:]type:name") or theme attribute (in the form "?[package:][type:]name") containing a value of this type. Must be a color value, in the form of "#rgb", "#argb", "#rrggbb", or "#aarrggbb". The text color list of the calendar. android:calendarTextColor XML Attributes
textAfterTable: This corresponds to the global attribute resource symbol datePickerMode. Related Methods android:dayOfWeekBackground The background color for the date selector 's day of week. May be a reference to another resource, in the form "@[+][package:]type:name" or to a theme attribute in the form "?[package:][type:]name". May be a color value, in the form of "#rgb", "#argb", "#rrggbb", or "#aarrggbb". This corresponds to the global attribute resource symbol dayOfWeekBackground. Related Methods android:dayOfWeekTextAppearance The text color for the date selector's day of week. Must be a reference to another resource, in the form "@[+][package:]type:name" or to a theme attribute in the form "?[package:][type:]name". This corresponds to the global attribute resource symbol dayOfWeekTextAppearance. Related Methods android:endYear The last year (inclusive), for example "2010". Must be an integer value, such as "100". This may also be a reference to a resource (in the form "@[package:]type:name") or theme attribute (in the form "?[package:][type:]name") containing a value of this type. This corresponds to the global attribute resource symbol endYear. Related Methods
